Title: NSC boss hails Ogun’s sports devt, eyes national reforms
Summary: Chairman of the National Sports Commission hails Ogun State for its exceptional hosting of the ongoing National Sports Festival . Mallam Shehu Dikko described it as a game-changer for sports development in Nigeria .

Title: Saudi Arabia denies Sheikh Gumi entry for Hajj
Summary: Sheikh Ahmad Gumi barred from performing the 2025 Hajj despite being granted a valid visa and arriving in the Kingdom as part of Nigeria’s official religious delegation . Gumi, known for his Islamic views, has been barred by Saudi Arabian authorities .

Title: IFAB appoints ex-international Sunday Oliseh to board
Summary: Sunday Oliseh has been appointed to the International Football Association Board (IFAB) The former Super Eagles coach and captain made this known on his X account on Monday as he expressed joy at joining IFAB’s .

Title: Rainstorm destroys over 60 houses in Ekiti communities
Summary: Ekiti State Government has deployed a team to assess the level of damage caused by last Monday’s severe rainstorm . The severe storm caused extensive damage to both public and private properties in parts of Omuo, Iworo, Isaya and some other communities in Ekiti .

Title: Uzodimma sacks Imo attorney-general
Summary: Imo State Governor, Hope Uzodimma, has approved the immediate removal of the state Attorney General and Commissioner for Justice, Cyprain O C. Akaolisa . His sack was disclosed on Monday in a statement issued by the Commissioner for Information, Public .

Title: FIRS office closure: Tinubu, Zacch Adedeji meet in Aso Villa
Summary: Bola Tinubu met with the Executive Chairman of the Federal Inland Revenue Service, Dr. Zacch Adedeji . The meeting came on the heels of a directive by the Minister of the FCT, Nyesom Wike, ordering the sealing of a FIRS office .

Title: Catholic priest, female passenger swept away by erosion in Niger
Summary: Father James Omeh was swept away by floodwaters alongside a female passenger, Charity John, in Lapai Local Government Area . The Catholic Church in Niger State has been thrown into mourning following the tragic death .

Title: Angry youths set Kano police station ablaze
Summary: Angry youths in the Rano Local Government area of Kano State have gone berserk . Angry youths set ablaze part of Rano Divisional police station ablaze over the alleged brutality of one of their own, Abdullahi Musa .

Title: Lagos to publish report on illegal buildings in Banana Island as demolition looms
Summary: Report on illegal structures marked for demolition on Banana Island is ready and will be made public soon . Lagos to publish report on illegal buildings in Banana Island as demolition looms .

Title: 7 killed as speeding cement laden truck loses control in Benue
Summary: At least seven persons have been killed in a lone accident involving a truck laden with cement . The accident occurred along Katsina-Ala - Zaki Biam Road in Benue .

Title: VIDEO: Funke Akindele heads to Tanzania for final leg of Priscilla Ojo, Juma Jux’s wedding
Summary: Popular Nollywood actress, Funke Akindele, has been confirmed as one of the celebrities attending the final wedding of influencer Priscilla Ojo and Tanzanian music star, Juma Jux . The couple earlier held their wedding dubbed “JP 2025,” in Lagos . Their traditional and white weddings were

Title: Windstorm destroys houses in Kano community
Summary: Many people have been rendered homeless in Madobi Local Government Area of Kano State following a devastating windstorm on Sunday night . The windstorm, accompanied by a downpour, had also destroyed many residential buildings, public infrastructure, and power lines, leaving hundreds of residents of the area homeless and without a power supply .

Title: Ex-Plateau senator dumps PDP
Summary: Former Senator in Plateau State, I. D. Gyang, has resigned from the Peoples Democratic Party . Gyang cited the party’s deviation from democratic principles and lack of a people-centric approach . He represented Plateau North Senatorial District in the 9th Assembly . The decision comes after nearly a decade of passionate membership

Title: PDP asks court to sack Osun lawmaker over defection
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party has approached the Federal High Court in Abuja, seeking the removal of the lawmaker representing Obokun/Oriade Federal Constituency of Osun State, Oluwole Oke . Oke, a six-term lawmaker, had defected from the PDP to the All Progressives Congress .

Title: VIDEO: FCTA seals NAPTIP headquarters in Abuja
Summary: The Federal Capital Territory Administration, on Monday, sealed the headquarters of the National Agency for the Prohibition of Trafficking in Persons in Abuja . This action follows the FCTA’s announcement on Sunday, stating its intention to reclaim property affected by the revocation of 4,794 land titles due to non-payment of ground rent spanning
